entries.name: Guild Brief
entries: {@creature Anohi|domule} informs the party that they are being hired to investigate a town slowly going crazy. She gives the following speech:

entries.name: Anohi
entries: Thank you all for coming in at such a late hour. We have a bit of an situation near Fairkeep. Their king, King Macus, has hired us (at a massive fee) to assist since we can portal there. To explain our plan of action, our leader of the Brassbrows, Seamus Droug

entries.name: Seamus
entries: Thank you. About 2 weeks ago King Macus received a report that the citizens of Crowshire were starting to act... weird. Their guard confirmed the towns folk were pregressivly going crazy but were extra alarmed when they found evidence of upturned grave sites. Naturally, this is very concerning.

We have secured an emergency use of Fairkeep's Gate Ring. Their guards should have set it up inside of Crowshire within the hour. Myself and the available Brassbrows will be rounding up the townsfolk so that they can be herded to quarantine camp being setup several miles away.
The rest of you will be split up into four groups to investigate the area and try to determine the root cause of this strangeness.
You have two hours to ready up and be at the Tri-Citadel. It will still be ass'o clock in the morning where so be prepare for darkness.
Any questions?

entries.name: Anohi
entries: Thank you Seamus. I have awoken the quartermaster. Our shop is open should you need any basic supplies.

entries.name: The Tri-Citadel
entries: The Tri-Citadel is a massive castle like structure made of three very large cylinder connected by a triangle
The party see several other Silver Wings gathered at one of the circular. Seamus is already there. He is surrounded by other Silver Wings that look to be the more... muscular variant on horse back
There are several tired looking wizards in green-silver uniforms. The most tired look, a young gnome holding a mug of coffee, approaches the group

entries.name: Wedbit
entries: Seamus, good to see you. I wish we didn't have to keep meeting during time-sensitive-work-related jobs. Anyways, we got the confirmation from the Fairkeep Guard that they have their Gate Ring setup. If you will bring your crew and horses around, my apprentices will get you sent.

Everyone enters one of the walled cylinder and see a large circular room connected by several heavy wooden doors. The doors have runes embedded and all but one has a massive beam locking them in place.

One door is unlocked and open already. Inside the party see a short hallway that leads to another circular room. In the center of the room is thick 20 foot copper ring embedded in the floor. A few more green-silver robed people are slowly walking around it activating glyphs in the floor. Wedbit turns and faces the party:

entries.name: Wedbit
entries: Due to lack of information regarding how this madness is spreading, this portal is uni-directional. We will not be allowing anything on the other side to return. As a matter a fact, after you lot are sent threw, we will be disabling this portal and canceling the Tradora Gate's connection with Fairkeep until we know it is safe. Good luck.

Webit flips a small coin to the center of the copper ring which triggers a glow of arcane energy. The copper ring flips up where half slides underground while the other half creates an arch above ground. The party can see a dark town on the other side with a dozen well donned city guard stand in attention

Once through, the arcana energy fades and what looks to be a thick copper cable holding the shape of an arch collapse into a pile. Four of the guards step forward and immediately begins the task of coiling the heavy cable.

entries.name: Crowshire
entries: A crowns guard with gold edging around her cloak steps forward.

entries.name: Cpt. Claudia
entries: We are grateful for your expedient arrival. I'm Captain Claudia of the Fairkeep Guard.
Us twelve are the advance party. We have a Company of soldiers from Fairkeep's militia on their way here-ish. They will be in charge of setting up the camp for the citizens of Crowshire.

We are pretty sure whatever is affecting them is localized to this area and only after remaining here for a few days. We found a correlation between the citizens who travel in and out of the town often and how sane they remain. So we also recommend that no one stays within 10 miles of this town for more than 2 days.
Seamus requests for a map of the town and proceeds to rip it into 4. He hands each quadrant to the 4 remaining group.
The party will receive the quadrant with the graveyard and Jackson Manor

entries.name: The Graveyard
entries: At the graveyard, the party sees a simple plot of land with a wooden fence. Most of the tomb stones are plain with just a name and a date written on them. Vines from roses or squash spattered the graveyard while a basic stature of raven's head sits in the center.
The almost pleasant looking graveyard is starkly interrupted by the ripped down fence and torn up ground on the west side.

items: {@dc 5} Nature - This was not naturally occurring
{@dc 12} Nature - This matches the pattern of roots being ripped out of the ground
{@dc 10} Investigation - Footprints lead in and out of the ripped side
{@dc 15} Investigation - The footprint directly walk in and walk out, no signs of lots of stepping around or wandering.

entries.name: Nighttime
entries: If the party arrives during night, after about a short rest, anyone with a Passive Perception of {@dc 12} will hear slow treading footsteps
They will see a group of {@creature Gourd Sprout|domule} being lead by a few {@creature Gourd Adult|domule}. The Gourds will ignore the party and go straight to the graveyard

A {@creature Gourd Sprout|domule} will approach a gave and start latching to the ground. After a few minutes, the roots in the ground start slithering out of the ground and absorb into the {@creature Gourd Sprout|domule}. If left uninterrupted, will grow into a {@creature Gourd Adult|domule}. Once an {@creature Gourd Adult|domule}, the bones around the grave will be topside now. The new {@creature Gourd Adult|domule} collects the bones and joins the other Gourds. After a few graves are dug up, they shuffle back into the forest towards Jackson's Manor.

entries.name: Daytime
entries: If the party arrive during daylight, the events from {@adventure The Forest|02-jack|1|the forest} occur after a short rest
If the party has already visited the manor, the party might 'find' the entrance to the greenhouse near the graveyard

entries.name: The Forest
entries: Wither by following the Gourds or just cutting through the forest to get to Jackson Manor, the following will occur

items: The party will hear someone crying for help
If the party investigates, they will find two humans under attack by 2 more humans
If no one keeps an eye on the Gourds, the party loses the Gourds
You can use the {@creature Commoner|mm}, {@creature Bandit|mm}, and/or {@creature Guard|mm} stats with relabeled names/weapons

entries.name: Jackson Manor
entries: The following events can happen at the manor

items: There is a recipe for Bone Meal in the kitchen.
There is note in the bedroom talking about how {@creature Myconid Sovereign|mm} can spawn by placing spore in dead creatures.
The staircase can flip like a see-saw to grant access to a hidden office
There is a note in the dinning room where Jackson is complaining that Myconids keep dying during daylight and needs to find a solution to this issue
There is a note in the office from a R.S. that mentions a delivery of a {@creature Werewolf|mm} corpse.
There are traps all over the house. Use {@trap falling net}, {@trap bear Trap|xge}, and {@trap poison needle trap|xge}
If the party has already visited the graveyard, the cellar in the kitchen leads to the underground tunnels

entries.name: The Last Servant
entries: In the last bedroom, a servant has barred the door, set a basic drop trap behind the door awaits the party. Use {@trap Crossbow Trap|xge}.
Once inside, a scared servant will charge at the party with a candle stick yelling "Begone plant creatures!". But once he realizes he is being hunted by Gourds, he relaxes.
The servant introduce himself as Riley Parkley III, the house servant. In reality, it is {@creature Jackson Willmont|domule} who wants to use the party to kill the {@create Gourd Sovereign|domule}

items: Master Jackson has been trying to develop self maintaining crop
Three weeks ago he had a large crate delivered
Once week later, random things would get stolen. The privy pots, the pig slops, ash from the fireplace...
A few days ago, Jackson handed him a potion and said to be careful and stay safe. He has been fortifying the house every since

entries.name: Bone Meal

items: 1 kg bones (any)
200 ml evaporated urine
500 g forest droppings (rabbit seems to work best)
1 l water

entries: Crush bone into powder and mix with the urine. Please inside of sealable container and mix in water and droppings. Immediately seal as this will start smelling really bad real fast. Shake hard and leave to warm in direct sunlight for 4 days
Recommended to open on the 5th day and let the stench dissipate for a bit.
When applying to crops, recommended to sprinkle a thin layer of topsoil to cover smell

entries.name: Bedroom Letter
entries: Mr. Jackson,

My constituents and I were fascinated by your theory that you might be able to produce a Myconid from a plant instead of a corpse. We do believe you were right about using gourds or the squash family as a whole as it is easy to place the entire spore inside.

I also think you may need to apply the same technique used in orchards on the Myconid. Start with a Myconid sport that has already been laid in a corpse and then transfer it to the squash. With any luck, the spore will graft. The subsequent Myconid (and spore) should be much more receptive to spawning from a squash and after a few generations may not need a corpse at all.
Best of luck and please do tell us your results.
Dr. Yoza Corgim
Head of Herbology; Hue Academy

entries.name: Dinning Room Note
entries: Amendment 22

The few Myconid I could spawn quickly die in the sunlight. The adults are intelligent enough to see cover during the day but the sprouts are fairly intelligent and will work themselves to dead during the day

While I haven't found a good way to get them to be permanently sun resistant but I have an idea get them to instinctually grow a thick shell in sunlight. It will not keep them alive in sunlight forever, but in theory it prolong their life long enough for them to reach adulthood

entries.name: Hidden Office Letter
entries: Mr. Jackson,

Acquiring the Sovereign was difficult enough but acquiring the Blood of the Lycanthrope is a very dangerous task indeed. But you are in luck, we just so happen to have acquired a Werewolf for other reasons and can spare a vial or two. Please be caution with the sample, this one came from a particularly devote follower of Malar

Now that you have all that you need, please start producing results. We were interested in your theories because we thought they could benefit the agricultural world. But that will only happen if they actually work.
- R.S.

entries.name: The Greenhouse
entries: The greenhouse is actually a large underground hydroponics structure. The first area has ropes strung along the support beams that are glowing. They appear to be projecting enough daylight to be growing plants. There is a variety of squash, carrots, lettuces, and other common crops.
The back room is separated by a curtain and is dark, only illuminated by bioluminescence fungus. The entire room is low light. Inside is the {@creature Gourd Sovereign|domule}
The Sovereign just wants to be left alone and tells The Topsiders to leave him to his work.
The Sovereign is collecting bones and other compostable items to create nutrients. The Topsiders are inconsequential and Gourds will continue to expand.

The Sovereign knows it was created by {@creature Jackson Willmont|domule} and once The Sovereign played along until he was powerful enough to refuse Jackson. He tried to eliminate Jackson but Jackson escaped.
It won't take much effort for the Sovereign to get annoyed and just try to kill the party for its bones

entries.name: The Research Room
entries: In the research room, there is a table with bloody mess underneath a rug. The body is belongs to an elderly man in a blank tailcoat.
If found, {@creature Jackson Willmont|domule} will reveal himself as Jackson himself.

items: He wanted the party to kill {@creature Gourd Sovereign|domule} since he has lost control over it.
Jackson was hoping to create a shapechanging {@creature Myconid Sprout|mm} that could transform into something that could withstand sunlight
When Jackson was working with {@creature Werewolf|mm} blood, he got infected. His servant Riley Parkley III tried to kill him before he turned but he killed him.
Now that he as been found out, he has to kill the witnesses
{@creature Maddoc Batul|domule} - the cool Batir Rider half-orc
{@creature Batir Rider|domule} - a generic half-orc rider
{@creature Saf Mosquest|domule} - the leader of the Black Gates
{@creature Cpt. Gwindish Brillevian|domule} - Captain of Seconda
{@creature Black Gate Agent|domule} - the average member of the Black Gates
{@creature Black Gate Wizard|domule} - the average spell caster of the Black Gates

entries.name: Guild Brief
entries: Anohi pulls Odven aside and informs her that she think he would be best suited for an upcoming job.
The dwarves of Lugo want abled people who could have a cover story for traveling up and down The Strodred Canal. She figured Odven's Engineer Guild membership allow him to create a cover story
The mission starts in 4 days. That should be enough if they keep pace on horseback or use the portal for 50GP each

entries.name: By Portal
entries: Every other day, the Tradora Gate opens a portal with Lugo. For 2 hours, traffic flows in both directions. Once on the other side...

entries.name: Lugo's Towers Gate
entries: The gate is at the base of a singular large mountain. Three massively tall brick and stone towers surround the portal connected by a basic 12 similarly bricked wall. All three sides of the wall have large gates that are held up above the entrances, ready to be dropped down to block passageways.

The towers have spiraling staircases on the outside and no windows. At the base of each tower there are heavy wooden door, each with arcane glyphs inscribed on them an each directly facing the portal.

entries.name: By Land
entries: If the party travels by land they are met by a party of Half-Orcs on horseback on their to Lugo.

The Half-Orcs are completing their 1st Dux Odyssey where they must travel 200 miles in 3 days on horseback, service with the tribe's rangers and service with a tribe's ally. Once complete, they will be Dragoons The Half-Orc party is very friendly and wishes to travel with you to Lugo

entries.name: Chief Jark's Brief
entries: At Logo, it is discovered that there are other groups hired for this... mysterious job.

items: The Silver Wings - for their success at solving the Crowshire incident
The Rocs - for their experiences in the underworld
Batir Warriors - for their land mobility

entries: Everyone is corralled into room with a scaled model of Lugo, The Strodred Canal, and the Yellow Sea. There are topographical maps of specific sections of the canal, charts of weather patterns, and dates of repair jobs.

Already waiting in the room is a very weathered looking dwarf. He has a short braided beard and is covered in nautical tattoos. He is wearing teal slops with gold trimming. Next to him is a younger dwarf wearing regular shirt and paints but with matching teal and gold colors. Lastly, an ancient looking woman dwarf in white leather armor

entries.name: Chief Jark
entries: I am Jark Logas, Chief Engineer of the Strodred Canal. This is my assistant Dathen and over there is Captain of the Guard, Sirihelda. Thank you all for being here.

You may have heard about that Canal Gate Seconda suffered a gate failure that partially flooded the lands for 2 miles before some druids who just so happen to be intervened and earth walled it shut. You may have heard that it was caused by barge previously that day running into the gates themselves, which compromised the structural integrity. This was a lie.
A week prior we received a threatening letter by a group that calls themselves the Black Gates saying we were to announce plans permanently close off the canals.
Three weeks prior to THAT, a group of Tritons were granted audience with King Borsic and demanded that Lugo would be in danger if they did not close and fill the canals.
Naturally, we are suspicious

entries.name: The Metallic Mile
entries: It is actually half a mile long, but still impressive. Repeating rows and rows of forges, tables, benches, anvils, and acid pools. Not every forge is burning but the ones that are have unique pennants. Chalk boards are displayed below the pennants listing the prices of varies items. Everything from weapons and armor to silverware and precious metal jewelry

entries.name: The Cooper's Keep
entries: A tavern embedded in the mountain. The room is a large circle. The outer wall is covered floor to ceiling with barrels. In the center is a load bearing support pillar, also surrounded with mounted barrels. A ringed bar surrounds the pillar.

items: Amrus - the tavern owner
Dulman - the errand dwarf

entries: 20 GP for a barrel of 7th Level of Hell Porter. 10 GP for a keg, 5 GP for the growler.
The porter is 16% alcohol and has a thick head. The head is ignitable.

entries.name: The Redla Ring
entries: The Market for the city.

A single underground market ring that circles the entire city. Every 100 feet there is a air shaft that also lets in light. Along the center path is 2 by 2 ft water way. Floating inside is some kind of glowing bioluminescent algae that seems to recharger around the air shafts. The glowing algae provides dim light for the main paths around The Redla Ring

entries.name: Arriving at Seconda
entries: The Captain of Seconda is a middle aged dwarven woman named {@creature Cpt. Gwindish Brillevian|domule}. She is a little annoyed that the team from the Engineer's Guild isn't actually a team from the Engineer's Guild, but she vents her frustrations at Chief Jark.

If asked, {@creature Cpt. Gwindish Brillevian|domule} tells the party that gates failed about 3 weeks ago. One of the gate door's hinges failed and a whole gate door was washed away. One hinge failing is a mistake. Two hinges failing at the same time is sabotage. While inspecting what was lift of the hinges, it appeared that metals warped apart. Luckily, the high flowing water quickly dragged a passenger barge that had a pair of druids. They used a {@spell Move Earth|phb} spell to stop the flooding
The dwarves has two {@item Cloak of the Manta Ray|dmg} they {@i might} be willing to share

entries.name: Seconda Gate
entries: On the northside, there is a tiny castle. It has a single tower that serves as a lookout and storeroom. It houses a team of 20 dwarves. 10 soldiers, 6 engineers, 2 cooks, a doctor, and the {@creature Cpt. Gwindish Brillevian|domule}.

A bridge crosses over the west-side of the lock gates where it connects with another tower. A few soldiers are stationed on both sides with little guard houses where they can take shelter on rainy or hot days. If asked, they also handle crossing fees (1 silver) except for any member of the Batir Nation, who have a heritage treaty with Lugo to allow free passage.
A barge is docked inside the locks. It contains general repair supplies such as shoring wood, metal straps, lumber, etc...

entries.name: From Below
entries: In the early morning, there is a disturbance in the water. A {@creature Plesiosaurus|mm} rushes out and attempts to scale the main tower guarding the gate locks. Any targeted interactions with the {@creature Plesiosaurus|mm} or {@dc 13} intelligence investigation will reveal that it is a {@spell Major Image|phb}

Meanwhile a group of {@creature Black Gate Agent|domule} and one {@creature Black Gate Wizard|domule} are attempting to weaken the door with a Triton made war hammer ({@item Second Wave Warhammer|domule}). They all look like Tritons because of a {@spell Seeming|phb} spell. Once more, a {@dc 13} intelligence investigation will reveal the illusion. They will all defend the one {@creature Black Gate Agent|domule} who is trying to knock down the gate with the {@item Second Wave Warhammer|domule}.

dataItem.name: Gate Lock
entries: Made of solid wood reenforced with iron

entries.name: A Black Gate is captured
entries: The captured Black Gate knows the following information:

items: The {@item Second Wave Warhammer|domule} came from a Second Wave Triton.

The Black Gates approached the Second Wind while they were leaving and proposed they joined forces to close the Canals. The Second Wind were wary of the Black Gates and a confrontation ensured. Some dwarves were killed as well as one Triton. This is where the {@item Second Wave Warhammer|domule} came from
The Black Gates plan on draining the canals to booby trap the both the castles and canal itself. Hopefully the continuing disruptions to the canals for many months

entries.name: While searching a Black Gate's body
entries: A note is found on the body.

entries.name: Note
entries: Trista will be fused shut while Seconda and Primate will be collapsed. Saf is personally leading the assault Bronc Keep. Our insiders should be able to prevent any messages from getting out so make sure keep the distractions on Trista or Seconda.
We will make sure Bronc Keep continues to send 'All Clear' to Lugo once we get Jark Logas's seal.

entries.name: Here comes the calvary
entries: Later that morning, {@creature Maddoc Batul|domule} along with a few {@creature Batir Rider|domule}, along with two strangers, come riding in.

They successfully defended Trista from a group of dwarves who were trying to impose themselves as {@creature Batir Rider|domule}. Upset that anyone would dare try to give the Batir Warriors a bad reputation. All dwarves were killed immediately. A few hours after the attack, the two strangers rode up to Trista

items: {@creature Palen Chavera|domule} the second in command of the Rocs
{@creature Zhu Li|domule} Palen's right hand man
Officially Celaena owns a very nice upscale and successful bookstore. But it is a well known secret that she also is the broker for assassin and hit jobs
She has expensive tastes. She wears a jewel encrusted long flowing dress. A Perception check (DC 8) reveals that she many dagger partially sewn into her dress
Celaena has a strange combination of morals. While she's okay with killing people for pay, she is extremely anti slavery
Celaena has a history of extreme retaliation if anyone double crosses her or steals anything from her
Celaena has a small entourage of beautiful assassins. They are constantly observing the crowds and reporting suspicious activity
All of Celaena's entourage has matching daggers with rose gold leaf etching down the blade and scabbard
Celaena have a personal partnership with Rhogar, acquiring poisons animals and plants
The Black Fang is actually the capital ship in Rhogar Seeker's fleet
He is officially a merchant, but in some circles, he is known for acquiring and selling exotic and illegal beasts and plants
Rhogar is surrounded by his crew. Unlike the typical sailor, his crew is well dressed and remarkably calm and civil
All of Rhogar's crew have matching rapiers with a blue sapphire on the pommel
Rhogar is a devout follower of {@deity Talos|forgotten realms|phb}, The Storm Lord. He wears a large medallion as a necklace with three lightning bolts radiating from a point
The Black Fang has been hiring the Korred rangers to capture debtors, and sells them into slavery at the Endove Islands
The Korreds is a company of wayfinders and guides. They are hired to lead caravans to any location.
The Korreds are also hired by debt collectors, loan sharks, and political asylum seekers to find persons of interest. They are bounty hunters.
Beauty Eye and his rangers can communicate via hand gestures.
Both Beauty Eye and his rangers all dress differently but have very noticeable tribal tattoos.
Beauty Eye finds Undead and Constructs abominations and distrusts anyone who uses or works with them.
The Korreds are constantly selling updated maps and gossip to Celaena

data.name: Chapter 1 - Jost's Trial
entries: Jost approaches Kohl and lets him know that the next mission is his first trial to join the Nightflyers
There is an upcoming auction hosted by The Maeve Bank, a bank with close ties to several guilds, mobs, and kingdoms
At the auction, will be three known mob bosses.

items: The Black Fang, run by a male dragonborn named Rhogar Seeker
The Korreds, run by a male tabaxi named Beauty's Eye
The Vaults, run by a female human named Celaena Taurus

entries.name: Alliances
entries: The Vaults use The Black Fangs as a supplier for exotic poisons and venoms
The Black Fangs have been chartering The Korreds. Otherwise, The Black Fangs never charter anyone
The Korreds have been selling up-to-date information (maps, political news, gossip, etc...) to The Vaults after each of their treks

entries.name: Celaena hates Slavery
entries: Rhogar has 'bought out' the debt owed to loan sharks and used some of Beauty Eye's trackers to find them and enslave them.
Rhogar sells the captured to the warrior nations in the Endove Islands. The Korreds take a little of the cut.

entries.name: Plot Hooks
items: It will be suspicious when it is revealed that The Korreds are getting paid to travel with The Black Fangs, instead of the other way around.
There is paperwork that the party can find that reveals that the ships are consuming 10 time more rations that what the ships normally consume.
Some of Rhogar's sailors are wearing necklaces with purple volcanic glass. This glass is only found from the chain of volcanoes that make up the Endove Islands.

entries: If Celaena finds out by that either Rhogar or Beauty Eye are involved in slavery, she will break relationships with both. She may even kill one of them later

entries.name: Rhogar is surprisingly religious
entries: Rhogar is a diviout follower of {@deity Talos|forgotten realms|phb}, God of Storms. He is constantly wearing a large amulet with three lightning bolts radiating from a central point
Rhogar will dislike anyone who insults {@deity Talos|forgotten realms|phb} or anyone who worships Talos's enemies

Rhogar is campaigning to install a monument at Knit Park, in {@book The Lanterarius District|dml-book|0|lanternarius district} for {@deity Talos|forgotten realms|phb}.  Rhogar even paid for the demolition of the old fountain begin building the new monument. But bureaucracy suddenly blocked him. It turns out Beauty Eye and Celaena worship {@deity Malar} and want to put their own stature. They are working behind the scenes to put up a fountain for {@deity Malar} instead.

entries.name: Plot Hooks
items: Beauty Eye's rangers can be caught bribing the City's Planning Director
A plan for a fountain for {@deity Malar} at Knit Park can be spotted within The Vaults Bookstore

entries.name: Beauty Eye does not like artificial life
entries: Beauty Eye will distrust anyone who has/works with Constructs or The Undead
Meanwhile, Rhogar has acquired a broken {@creature Shield Guardian|mm} and has commissioned Celaena to restore and build a new amulet

entries.name: Plot Hooks
items: Celaena was seen purchasing a platinum amulet and spent over 1000 GP on a rubies. While Celaena is known for having expensive tastes, this was an excitedly large purchase.
Rhogar has been supplying Celaena with rare toxic and poisons plants and animals... but no one can recall Celaena actually paying him. Perhaps there trading something other than gold?
Celaena has a artificer named Rowan who has been seen visiting Rhogar's warehouse daily
Rhogar's {@creature Shield Guardian|mm} is hidden in plain sight as a ornamental stature

entries: Beauty Eye will consider the construct an affront to nature break relationships with Rhogar if he finds out he has a construct.

entries.name: The shopkeeper's husband
entries: The shopkeeper, Madam Gladdington, thinks highly of Celaena since she is somewhat responsible for finding her current husband; Kenny. Kenny was a former slave that was noticed by one of Celaena's librarians and was personally rescued by Celaena (herself?).

entries.name: The Story of Kenny
entries: Kenny's parents sold him when he was young to pay off some debts. As the years went by, he met other sold-off slaves and realized the lord preyed on poor families and built up a small labor force of slaves.

One day, he found the lord assassinated and pinned to his bedroom wall. Celaena was in the kitchen and offered them a new life if they did not peak of this incident. He (and several others) where taken to Fairkeep and given a months salary to get situated.
A few years later, he met Gladdinton and a few years after that, got married.

entries.name: The delivery
entries: The party will notice a {@creature Korred Ranger|domule} and a {@creature Vault Assassin|domule} talking with a man wearing a Fairkeep civil servant uniform. It's actually the City's Planning Director. The {@creature Korred Ranger|domule} and {@creature Vault Assassin|domule} can be seen bribing the Planning Director and handing him a scroll.

The scroll is a plan for a {@deity Malar} fountain for Knit Park, in {@book The Lanterarius District|dml-book|0|lanternarius district}. A copy of the plans can be found in either The Vault or The Black Fang lodge.
They are bribing the Planning Director to block Rhogar's plans for installing a {@deity Talos|forgotten realms|phb} fountain at Knit Park.

items: Manon Blackbeak - heir to the Blackbeaks and Crochan clan
Almo Blackbeak - the eldest and stewart Matron to the Blackbeaks
Drezia - Almo's grandaghter
Willa - Almo's first in command
Abraxos - Manon's Wyvern mount
The party is hired to capture a witch, Manon Blackbeak
Manon is hiding in the gnome city of Hue
Manon is specifically hiding in shop called "Windy Saddles and Supplies"
Manon was hiding her Wyvern in a {@creature hippogriff} stable behind Windy Saddles and Supplies
The party will be followed by the late Matron's personal coven
The shadowing witches will attempt to kill Manon, should they see an opportunity
Manon does not wish to return, knowing she will start a civil war

entries.name: Windy Saddles and Supplies
entries: Run by a female gnome named Taphina Fiddlefront.
Taphina hired a human girl named Tracy Marsh two months ago to help out with the store
The store sells {@filter all saddles|items|type=tack and harness}

data.name: Chapter 1 - The Briefing
entries: One morning the party wakes up to find a letter slipped under the door. It is a summons by Anohi for a mission. You all arrive around the same time to the conference room where Anohi is already waiting for you. Once everyone has gathers, she paces back and forth a few time before resting both hands on the table.

entries.name: Anohi
entries: Last night I was approached by some clients interested in a standard find-and-return persons job. While these are not uncommon their conditions were unusual. They demanded that anyone who presently in the building at that time could not be hired. The person they are looking for must be important or they have more money than sense, because this job will average 600 GP per person
The Flumph Kite Festival is happening right now and our clients requested that you meet them on a hill, just west of the festival grounds. You are looking for three youngish human women.

items: The client were abrupt. She thinks they would prefer if you are direct when talking with them

Anohi had a hard time sensing their motives. By default, she would appreciate it if the party could confirm that they are not engaging in the slave trade. If the party thinks they are, they have permission to break the contract and Anohi will support them in any fallout.
Anohi is uncertain if they are entirely human

entries.name: The Flumph Kit Festival
entries: You approaches the hill on the west side of the festival you see three women in leather riding leathers, even though no horse is present. As you get close, one of the women holds up a hand stopping you. A particularly strong gust of wind blows past you and you see the witches inhale deeply through the nose as the air continues past them. A few moments later, the women lowers her hand.

entries.name: Almo
entries: That is close enough, stay where you are. You are Anohi's guild members. Let us get straight to business.

I am Almo Blackbeak, along with me are Drezia and Willa Blackbeak. And we are members of the Blackbeak Witch Clan. For the better part of nine months we have been tracking one of our own, Manon Blackbeak. We tracked her to this content to this city. We lost her trail when we used the Tri-Citadel's portal. After inquiring around we believe she took the portal that goes to the city of Hue. We want you to find her and bring her to us. Alive.

items: They all have the same last name because they are part of the same clan. Not because they are related by blood (though some are)
Manon killed their leader, the Matron Blackbeak

Witches have a heighten sense of smell. Given our long history with Manon, she will be able to recognize our scent easily.  While we too can track her by scent, she has been on this continent for months longer than us and now has an advantage over us. We have our pride but we are not stupid. Commissioning resources is not beneath us.
Manon escaped on her mount. She has historically shown an attachment to her mount and we doubt she will abandon it

entries.name: Redstone Docks
entries: Unlike other cities, these docks are permanent red brickwork. This dock is also advanced enough that each pier has its own wooden crane.
There are 16 piers and they are all almost full.
Rhogar leased an entire pier where three ships are currently docked. He has also leased his own warehouse that seconds as his headquarters

entries.name: The Bolt District
entries: Two whole blocks of clothing stores, tailors, fabric shops, and boutiques. Noteworthy stores include:

entries.name: Rose Gold
entries: For chic outfits, cocktail dresses, and gowns

entries.name: Beatnix
entries: For outfits that have more fabric then most tents

entries.name: Southface
entries: Fashionable active-ware

entries.name: Darrington's
entries: Hat and accessories for all occasions

entries.name: Polywears
entries: Second-hand and overstocked clothes

entries.name: Madame Lebrace
entries: Tailor and customizations

entries.name: Westwall
entries: A district outside of Fairkeep wall full of pubs and taverns.
A popular location for farmers to retire to in the evening without having to go into the walled city itself
It is also where The Korred's Lodge resides

entries.name: Lanternarius district
entries: A hexagon district where oil street lights are installed. At night, the entire district is well lit creating a please nightlife.
This is where the affluent stores, restaurants, theaters, and parks exist
This is also where Celaena's bookstore: The Oakwald Bookstore

entries.name: The Flags District
entries: The main market area for the city. In these district, no builder is taller than two stories and most shops have a large flag masts that leans over the roads, advertising their storefront
Noteworthy stores include:

entries.name: Whitehorn Wares
entries: A magical items shop

entries.name: Redds Hammer
entries: A weapon and armor smith

entries.name: Jo Castirons
entries: High quality cookware and kitchen tools

entries.name: Blue Hexona
entries: A richer, affluent zone. No one is denied entry here but the goods and services here are more expensive.

entries.name: Windy Saddles and Supplies
entries: Run by a female gnome named Taphina Fiddlefront.
Taphina hired a human girl named Tracy Marsh two months ago to help out with the store
The store sells {@filter all saddles|items|type=tack and harness}
The store does custom fittings and has a stable in the back where they can keep {@creature riding horse} and {@creature hippogriff} overnight

entries.name: The Bull's Eye
entries: Owned and run by Amen Wright, the Second
The store sells {@filter black powered weapons and accessories|items|type=firearm;renaissance}, but you must have a Hue License or a Voucher of Competency
This store also sells some specialty items, only sold here.
{@item Scatter Pistol|domule} for 500GP

item.name: Scatter Pistol
entries: A single pistol with four barrels. Thanks to this design, this pistol has the following customization:

items: While your Scatter Pistol have at least one round of ammunition, you may ignore the {@b Loading} property.

If your Scatter Pistol is loaded with all four rounds, you may perform a {@b Burst Fire} attack except it is constrained to a 5 by 10-foot rectangle instead of a 10-foot cube. This will consume all four rounds.
{@b Reload} on your turn only loads a single round of ammunition. Not all four.

item.name: Second Wave Warhammer
entries: While submerged in water, becomes surprisingly lightweight and does not sink under its own weight. The player may use the two-handed damage die while wielding with one hand
The Warhammer has 3 charges. You may spend a charge to:

items: Give your weapon the siege property while hitting a structure
Deal an additional {@damage 2d4} force damage while hitting a Monstrosity

entries: If you spend a charge on an invalid target type, the charge is lost. You regain all charges after a long rest

item.name: Wand of Illusions
entries: This wand has 3 charges. When casting a spell that is from the school of {@i illusion}, you may spend charges to reduce the spell slot cost of the spell to a minimum of level 1. You must know the spell and you must have the spell prepared.

{@i Example:} You are a level 5 Wizard. You have prepared {@spell Major Image|phb} but you have already used your two level 3 spell slots. You may spend two charges to reduce the spell cost of {@spell Major Image|phb} to level 1 (But the spell is still cast at level 3)

legendaryGroup.name: Corrupt Gourd Sovereign
lairActions: On Initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Gourd Sovereign can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects: he can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

entries: Gourd Sovereign causes four {@creature gas spore||gas spores} or {@creature violet fungus||violet fungi} to appear in unoccupied spaces that she chooses within the lair. They vanish after 1 hour.

entries.name: Less Deadly
entries: The {@bold Death Burst} in the {@creature gas spore||gas spores} only causes the initial poison damaged and does not infect the targeted creates.

items: Up to four plant creatures that are friendly to Gourd Sovereign and that Gourd Sovereign can see can use their reactions to move up to their speed and make one weapon attack.
Gourd Sovereign uses either her Infestation Spores or her Mind Control Spores, centered on a mushroom or other fungus within her lair, instead of on herself.

regionalEffects: The region containing Gourd Sovereign's lair is warped by his magic, creating one or more of the following effects:

items: Molds and fungi grow on surfaces within 6 miles of the lair, even where they would normally find no purchase.
Plant life within 1 mile of the lair becomes infested with parasitic fungi, slowly mutating as it is overwhelmed.

If a humanoid spends at least 1 hour within 1 mile of the lair, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or descend into a madness determined by the Madness of Gourd Sovereign table. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw can't be affected by this regional effect again for 24 hours.

regionalEffects: If Gourd Sovereign dies, these effects fade over the course of {@dice 1d10} days.

regionalEffects.name: Madness of Gourd Sovereign
entries: If a creature goes mad in Gourd Sovereign's lair or within line of sight of the demon lord, roll on the Madness of Gourd Sovereign table to determine the nature of the madness, which is a character flaw that lasts until cured. See the {@book Dungeon Master's Guide|dmg|8|madness} for more on madness.

entries.caption: Madness of Gourd Sovereign
rows: "I must collect any bones I see"

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

trait.name: The Yielding
entries: When a witch is reduced to 0 hit pints, before fading to unconsciousness they can choose to undergo The Yielding. If so, all creatures within 30 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Necrotic damage on a failure, or half a much as a success.
If an Irontooth Witch undergoes The Yielding then they no longer make Death Saving Throws and are instantly dead and cannot be revived. Their body instantly turns to ash upon completion.

Furthermore, if The blackbeak witch can smell the target, they have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

entries: The gourd targets one corpse of a humanoid or a Large or smaller beast within 5 feet of it and releases spores at the corpse. In 24 hours, the corpse rises as a spore servant. The corpse stays animated for {@dice 1d4 + 1} weeks or until destroyed, and it can't be animated again in this way.

action.name: Hallucination Spores
entries: The gourd ejects spores at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The {@condition poisoned} target is {@condition incapacitated} while it hallucinates. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Euphoria Spores (1/Day)
entries: The gourd releases a cloud of spores in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. Other creatures in that area must each succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. The save DC is 8 + the gourd's Constitution modifier + the gourd's proficiency bonus. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect early on itself on a success. When the effect ends on it, the creature gains one level of {@condition exhaustion}

entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

trait.name: Relentless Endurance
entries: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You cant use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: {@feat Savage Attacker}
entries: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon s damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

trait.name: Menacing
entries: You have proficiency in the intimidate skill.

trait.name: Horse Companion
entries: The Batir Rider has a favorite horse and has advantage on any animal handling checks with him

trait.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

action.name: {@item Hand Crossbow|phb}
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h 0}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: {@item Shortsword|phb}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.
Maddoc carries two {@item Shortsword|phb|Shortswords} and prefers using the 2nd {@item Shortsword|phb} over using a {@item Hand Crossbow|phb}

trait.name: Slasher
entries: Once per turn when you hit a creature with an attack that deals slashing damage, you can reduce the speed of the target by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
When you score a critical hit that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has disadvantage on all attack rolls.

trait.name: The Yielding
entries: When a witch is reduced to 0 hit pints, before fading to unconsciousness they can choose to undergo The Yielding. If so, all creatures within 30 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Necrotic damage on a failure, or half a much as a success.
If an Irontooth Witch undergoes The Yielding then they no longer make Death Saving Throws and are instantly dead and cannot be revived. Their body instantly turns to ash upon completion.

trait.name: Witch's Keen Smell
entries: The blackbeak witch has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}).
Furthermore, if The blackbeak witch can smell the target, they have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

trait.name: Harden Witch
entries: You have five {@dice 1d6|Superiority Dice} to spend on:
{@optfeature Disarming Attack}, {@optfeature Parry}, {@classFeature Stunning Strike|Monk||5}, {@optfeature Riposte}
All Saving Throws are {@dc 15}. You regain all your {@dice 1d6|Superiority Dice} after a short or long rest

trait.name: Action Surge
entries: On your turn, you can take one additional action.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.
If the attack hits, you may enter a {@classFeature Rage|Barbarian||1}. If so, you get advantage when attacking the last target you bite.

action.name: Slash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

bonus.name: Witches Strike
entries: When you use the Attack action, you may perform a Slash or Bite as a Bonus Action.
You may only perform a Slash if you did not use a two-handed weapon.

items.name: Quickened Spell
items.entry: When you Cast a Spell that has a Casting Time of 1 action, you can spend 2 sorcery points to change the Casting Time to 1 Bonus Action for this casting.

items.name: Distant Spell
items.entry: When you Cast a Spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell. When you Cast a Spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.

items.name: Eyes of the Dark
items.entry: If you cast {@spell darkness} with (2) sorcery points, you can see through the darkness created by the spell.

trait.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: Starting at 1st level, your existence in a twilight state between life and death makes you difficult to defeat. When damage reduces you to 0 hit points, you can make a Charisma saving throw ({@dc 5} + the damage taken). On a success, you instead drop to 1 hit point. You can't use this feature if you are reduced to 0 hit points by radiant damage or by a critical hit.
After the saving throw succeeds, you can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

trait.name: Creating Spell Slots
entries: You can transform unexpended sorcery points into one spell slot as a bonus action on your turn. The created spell slots vanish at the end of a long rest. The Creating Spell Slots table shows the cost of creating a spell slot of a given level. You can create spell slots no higher in level than 5th.
{@i Converting a Spell Slot to Sorcery Points}. As a bonus action on your turn, you can expend one spell slot and gain a number of sorcery points equal to the slot's level.

trait.name: Dwarven Resilence
entries: Advantage on saving throws agains poison and resistance against poison damage.

action.name: {@feat Dual Wielder|phb}
entries: You master fighting with two weapons, gaining the following benefits:

items: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while you are wielding a separate melee weapon in each hand.
You can use two-weapon fighting even when the one-handed melee weapons you are wielding aren't light.
You can draw or stow two one-handed weapons when you would normally be able to draw or stow only one.

action.name: {@item Battleaxe|phb}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: One-Handed Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage. One-Handed
Female Human
{@creature Palen Chaevera|domule}'s right hand woman.

trait.name: Rogue Features
entries: {@classFeature Cunning Action|Rogue|PHB|2}, {@classFeature Sneak Attack|Rogue|PHB|1}

trait.name: Inquisitive
entries: {@subclassFeature Ear for Deceit|Rogue||Inquisitive|xge|3}, {@subclassFeature Eye for Detail|Rogue||Inquisitive|xge|3}, {@subclassFeature Insightful Fighting|Rogue||Inquisitive|xge|3}

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zin is a 20-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save{@dc 20}, {@hit +12} to hit with spell attacks). Zin has the following 24 spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The zin has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the zin to sleep.

trait.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

trait.name: Keeper of Souls
entries: When an enemy you can see dies within 30 feet of you, you or one ally of your choice that is within 30 feet of you regains hit points equal to the enemys number of Hit Dice. You can use this feature only if you aren't {@condition incapacitated}. Once you use it, you can't do so again until the start of your next turn.

action.name: Eyes of the Graves
entries: As an action, you can open your awareness to magically detect undead. Until the end of your next turn, you know the location of any undead within 60 feet of you that isn't behind total cover and that isn't protected from divination magic. This sense doesn't tell you anything about a creature's capabilities or identity.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (+4). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

action.name: Fey Step (Eladrin - Spring)
entries: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

Spring. When you use your Fey Step, you can touch one willing creature within 5 feet of you. That creature then teleports instead of you, appearing in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet of you.

reaction.name: Sentinel at Death's Door
entries: As a reaction when you or an ally that you can see within 30 feet of you suffers a critical hit, you can turn that attack into a normal hit. Any effects triggered by a critical hit are canceled.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (+4). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

monster.name: Tiamat's Red Dragon

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 56 ({@damage 16d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fluff.name: Young Red Dragon

entries: The most covetous of the true dragons, red dragons tirelessly seek to increase their treasure hoards. They are exceptionally vain, even for dragons, and their conceit is reflected in their proud bearing and their disdain for other creatures. The odor of sulfur and pumice surrounds a red dragon, whose swept-back horns and spinal frill define its silhouette. Its beaked snout vents smoke at all times, and its eyes dance with flame when it is angry. Its wings are the longest of any chromatic dragon, and have a blue-black tint along the trailing edge that resembles metal burned blue by fire.

The scales of a red dragon wyrmling are a bright glossy scarlet, turning a dull, deeper red and becoming as thick and strong as metal as the dragon ages. Its pupils also fade as it ages, and the oldest red dragons have eyes that resemble molten lava orbs.

entries.name: Mountain Masters
entries: Red dragons prefer mountainous terrain, badlands, and any other locale where they can perch high and survey their domain. Their preference for mountains brings them into conflict with the hill-dwelling copper dragons from time to time.

entries.name: Arrogant Tyrants
entries: Red dragons fly into destructive rages and act on impulse when angered. They are so ferocious and vengeful that they are regarded as the archetypical evil dragon by many cultures.

No other dragon comes close to the arrogance of the red dragon. These creatures see themselves as kings and emperors, and view the rest of dragonkind as inferior. Believing that they are chosen by Tiamat to rule in her name, red dragons consider the world and every creature in it as theirs to command.

entries.name: Status and Slaves
entries: Red dragons are fiercely territorial and isolationist. However, they yearn to know about events in the wider world, and they make use of lesser creatures as informants, messengers, and spies. They are most interested in news about other red dragons, with which they compete constantly for status.

When it requires servants, a red dragon demands fealty from chaotic evil humanoids. If allegiance isn't forthcoming, it slaughters a tribe's leaders and claims lordship over the survivors. Creatures serving a red dragon live in constant terror of being roasted and eaten for displeasing it. They spend most of their time fawning over the creature in an attempt to stay alive.

entries.name: Obsessive Collectors
entries: Red dragons value wealth above all else, and their treasure hoards are legendary. They covet anything of monetary value, and can often judge the worth of a bauble to within a copper piece at a glance. A red dragon has a special affection for treasure claimed from powerful enemies it has slain, exhibiting that treasure to prove its superiority.

A red dragon knows the value and provenance of every item in its hoard, along with each item's exact location. It might notice the absence of a single coin, igniting its rage as it tracks down and slays the thief without mercy. If the thief can't be found, the dragon goes on a rampage, laying waste to towns and villages in an attempt to sate its wrath.

entries.name: A Red Dragon's Lair
entries: Red dragons lair in high mountains or hills, dwelling in caverns under snow-capped peaks, or within the deep halls of abandoned mines and dwarven strongholds. Caves with volcanic or geothermal activity are the most highly prized red dragon lairs, creating hazards that hinder intruders and letting searing heat and volcanic gases wash over a dragon as it sleeps. With its hoard well protected deep within the lair, a red dragon spends as much of its time outside the mountain as in it. For a red dragon, the great heights of the world are the throne from which it can look out to survey all it controls-and the wider world it seeks to control.
Throughout the lair complex, servants erect monuments to the dragon's power, telling the grim story of its life, the enemies it has slain, and the nations it has conquered.

entries.name: Chromatic Dragons
entries: The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons represent the evil side of dragonkind. Aggressive, gluttonous, and vain, chromatic dragons are dark sages and powerful tyrants feared by all creatures-including each other.

entries.name: Driven by Greed
entries: Chromatic dragons lust after treasure, and this greed colors their every scheme and plot. They believe that the world's wealth belongs to them by right, and a chromatic dragon seizes that wealth without regard for the humanoids and other creatures that have "stolen" it. With its piles of coins, gleaming gems, and magic items, a dragon's hoard is the stuff of legend. However, chromatic dragons have no interest in commerce, amassing wealth for no other reason than to have it.

entries.name: Creatures of Ego
entries: Chromatic dragons are united by their sense of superiority, believing themselves the most powerful and worthy of all mortal creatures. When they interact with other creatures, it is only to further their own interests. They believe in their innate right to rule, and this belief is the cornerstone of every chromatic dragon's personality and worldview. Trying to humble a chromatic dragon is like trying to convince the wind to stop blowing. To these creatures, humanoids are animals, fit to serve as prey or beasts of burden, and wholly unworthy of respect.

entries.name: Dangerous Lairs
entries: A dragon's lair serves as the seat of its power and a vault for its treasure. With its innate toughness and tolerance for severe environmental effects, a dragon selects or builds a lair not for shelter but for defense, favoring multiple entrances and exits, and security for its hoard.

Most chromatic dragon lairs are hidden in dangerous and remote locations to prevent all but the most audacious mortals from reaching them. A black dragon might lair in the heart of a vast swamp, while a red dragon might claim the caldera of an active volcano. In addition to the natural defenses of their lairs, powerful chromatic dragons use magical guardians, traps, and subservient creatures to protect their treasures.

entries.name: Queen of Evil Dragons
entries: Tiamat the Dragon Queen is the chief deity of evil dragonkind. She dwells on Avernus, the first layer of the Nine Hells. As a lesser god, Tiamat has the power to grant spells to her worshipers, though she is loath to share her power. She epitomizes the avarice of evil dragons, believing that the multiverse and all its treasures will one day be hers and hers alone.

Tiamat is a gigantic dragon whose five heads reflect the forms of the chromatic dragons that worship her-black, blue, green, red, and white. She is a terror on the battlefield, capable of annihilating whole armies with her five breath weapons, her formidable spellcasting, and her fearsome claws.

Tiamat's most hated enemy is Bahamut the Platinum Dragon, with whom she shares control of the faith of dragonkind. She also holds a special enmity for Asmodeus, who long ago stripped her of the rule of Avernus and who continues to curb the Dragon Queen's power.

True dragons are winged reptiles of ancient lineage and fearsome power. They are known and feared for their predatory cunning and greed, with the oldest dragons accounted as some of the most powerful creatures in the world. Dragons are also magical creatures whose innate power fuels their dreaded breath weapons and other preternatural abilities.

Many creatures, including wyverns and dragon turtles, have draconic blood. However, true dragons fall into the two broad categories of chromatic and metallic dragons. The black, blue, green, red, and white dragons are selfish, evil, and feared by all. The brass, bronze, copper, gold, and silver dragons are noble, good, and highly respected by the wise.

Though their goals and ideals vary tremendously, all true dragons covet wealth, hoarding mounds of coins and gathering gems, jewels, and magic items. Dragons with large hoards are loath to leave them for long, venturing out of their lairs only to patrol or feed.

True dragons pass through four distinct stages of life, from lowly wyrmlings to ancient dragons, which can live for over a thousand years. In that time, their might can become unrivaled and their hoards can grow beyond price.
Dragon Age Categories

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasters
headerEntries: As Tiamet's favored, this dragon knows six spells, requiring no material components. {@filter Each spell's level can be no higher than 3rd|spells|level=0;1;2;3}. The dragon's spell save DC is 16, and it has {@dice 1d20+8|+8|Dragons as Innate Spellcasters} to hit with spell attacks. See the spell page for a list of spells the dragon is capable of casting. A selection of examples are shown below:
footerEntries: To cast spells, this dragon uses {@variantrule Spell Points|dmg}. This dragon has {@b 27 points} to spend. See {@table Variant: Spell Points; Spell Point Cost|dmg} for spending your spell points.
This dragon regains all their spell points after a long rest.

trait.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
(See {@spell Shapechange} for interactions. Assume this is not a concentration spell with no duration limit)

mythicHeader: Choose one trait to apply to your dragon

mythic.name: Magic Weaver
entries: You get +6 Spell Points and you can select {@filter spells up to 4th level|spells|level=0;1;2;3;4}

mythic.name: Expirenced
entries: You gain proficiency in any combination of four skills or tools of your choice.
If you select a skill you are already proficient in, you become expert at that skill.

mythic.name: Blessed by Tiamat
entries: Tiamat favors you. You gain the {@feat Lucky} feat.

mythic.name: Warrior's Spirit
entries: Skilled in combat, you gain the {@subclassFeature Superior Critical|Fighter|phb|Champion|phb|15}
